title: Suzlon Energy shares rise 19% in 3 months. Can the stock rally past Rs 86?
summary: Suzlon Energy’s shares surged nearly 19% in three months, driven by strong order wins and solid Q4FY25 earnings. Despite a recent 4-5% pullback, analysts see the stock consolidating within a bullish medium-term setup, with key support near Rs 60 and resistance around Rs 68-70.
fullContent: Suzlon Energy’s shares surged nearly 19% in three months, driven by strong order wins and solid Q4FY25 earnings. Despite a recent 4-5% pullback, analysts see the stock consolidating within a bullish medium-term setup, with key support near Rs 60 and resistance around Rs 68-70. A decisive breakout could push targets up to Rs 86.50.

title: Transitory vs. permanent tariffs
summary: We estimate transitory and permanent import tariff shocks in the United States over the postwar period. We find that transitory tariff increases are neither inflationary nor contractionary, and are not associated with monetary tightening.
fullContent: We estimate transitory and permanent import tariff shocks in the United States over the postwar period. We find that transitory tariff increases are neither inflationary nor contractionary, and are not associated with monetary tightening. In contrast, permanent tariff increases trigger a temporary rise in inflation (a one-off increase in the price level) and a brief […] The post Transitory vs. permanent tariffs appeared first on Marginal REVOLUTION.

fullContent: I apologise if this offends anyone, but I feel obliged to ask if Hong Kong has become a city of wusses. Hong Kong is set to be hit by inclement weather next week as an intensifying severe tropical storm is projected to move within 400km (249 miles) of the city on Thursday, the Observatory has said. The forecaster said Tropical Storm Podul, meaning willow tree in Korean, was centred about 1,140km...

title: Indian refiners can do without Russian oil, but with trade-offs

title: Mcap of 6 of top-10 valued firms erodes by ₹1.36 lakh crore; Reliance hit hard

summary: Thailand’s King Maha Vajiralongkorn has endorsed the appointment of Vitai Ratanakorn as the nation’s new central bank governor, more than two weeks after the cabinet picked the seasoned banker for the coveted role.
